Posts.Content: I had lumpectomy and lymph node biopsy on Wednesday. It's a 4 week wait though for results even tbough like you nothing suggests it's spread. The consultant and nurse did say sometimes a few cells get through. I'm also wondering what the likelihood is.
Posts.Title: Awaiting results senital lymph node

Posts.Content: I think many comments have convinced me that it's ok not to have the chemo. It may be that on Wednesday the oncologist will accept my decision. What definitely has come to light is the number 20 is a grey area but it's almost 8 weeks since my op(lumpectomy, my lymph nodes were clear) and 4months since the mammogram that detected the lump.  I'm feeling great, eating healthy, (breast cancer has made me open my eyes to the good and bad foods)regular exercise and a new job in the pipeline. Chemo in my opinion would be a step.backwards. I am prepared to live with my decision.
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: I received the result of my Onco test today. The BCN called me to say it was 20, she advised me to make a list of questions to ask the oncologist at my appointment next week. I told her that I was strongly against the chemo. Her take on this was what if you refused chemo and the cancer came back, would you regret the decision. Is there anyone else currently in a similar position? Xx
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for those who've responded I really appreciate people's different opinion it's how I come to make decisions. I did read that someone paid for an Endotype test? because they were in the grey area, it cost £1500 but only comes back with high or low.  I heavily side against chemo, my mum died from breast cancer she had chemo and I would say after it she didn't have good quality of life. My sister had breast cancer 3 yrs ago and said chemo was dreadful and made her really ill. I know many others too(frightening how many i do know who've had breast cancer) Of course if it was a case of 90%+ you won't get it back then chemo would be an easier decision.  I have done nothing but read up on the test for the last 2 weeks and have yet to find something that will convince me to have chemo. I asked the nurse if the Oncologist will pressurise me, she assured me he wouldn't.  I now play the waiting game again.
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Did you opt for the Chemo? The nearer it is the worse my worry becomes even though I've made a decision. X
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Walkergirl Thank you and good luck to you too. Yes I want to hear what the oncologist has to say. His secretary phoned me this morning my appointment is at 2pm now. This time tomorrow I will know. X
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Good news the oncologist said no need for chemo as there would be no benefit. He referred to 20 as a low score.I wish this had been clearer in the literature that was given to me I wouldn't have spent the last couple of weeks worrying. Could have done with this appointment a few weeks ago. What a relief.
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear that, not the news you wanted.A positive is it's clear cut and I assume the decision for chemo was a definite one from the doctor. As bad as it may be is you'll do it and come iut the other side and look how time passes. Sending you happy thoughts and remember so many people will be thinking about you. X
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Thank you Ash I will let you know what the outcome is.
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Starlightgirl my score was 21 and chemo was a definite no from the oncologist. I am interested in the fact of even after chemo and radiotherapy  why does cancer come back? and if i'd been told i needed chemo i would be asking that.
Posts.Title: ER positive clear nodes grade 3 and waiting on oncotype results.....

Posts.Content: Starlightgirl my score was 21 and chemo was a definite no from the oncologist. I am interested in the fact of even after chemo and radiotherapy  why does cancer come back? and if i'd been told i needed chemo i would be asking that.
Posts.Title: ER positive clear nodes grade 3 and waiting on oncotype results.....

Posts.Content: I thought my Onco of 20 was grey area but Oncologist said chemo would not be an option I wasn't given a choice which suited me. Nurse told me beforehand to to read up and research info as the booklets provided are very limited. Have completed 15 sessions of radiotherapy with no issues and have been on letrozole for 7 weeks without any side effects.
Posts.Title: ER positive clear nodes grade 3 and waiting on oncotype results.....

Posts.Content: Brilliant news what a relief! Now you can get on with your life. X Can I ask what do you mean regarding the score and the fact that you don't qualify for the onco test?
Posts.Title: ALL CLEAR RESULT !! Still have a dilema ?!?!

Posts.Content: Congratulations. My sister had the same and 3 and a half years after she's doing great.☺
Posts.Title: ALL CLEAR RESULT !! Still have a dilema ?!?!

Posts.Content: Had my first radiotherapy last night I am booked in after work at 4.45 every day but waiting over an hour so not a good start as the actually procedure only took 5 mins.  Not certain if I feel a bit sore this morning could be my imagination. X
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Nurse said that my left boob area could never see the sun again and would always need covering and best to put sun block on. I use Epsom salts, Magnesium salts and put turmeric in all my cooking although have laid off the bath salts until my radiotherapy is over.  I don't always assume that the nurses or doctors know everything and do my own research.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thank you JollyG cancer is something I didn't plan for so when the radiotherapy is over I'm going to look for a permanent job. Took my book to read last night but thankfully I only waited 10 mins extra so that's not a problem.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I'm on my 4th zap and using E45 should I be requesting a prescription cream or is that sufficient? Nurse said to still carry on with same deodorant unless it irritates me. Anyone had different advice?
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I work as a supply teacher not by choice but it's a position I find myself in. Unfortunately if I don't work I don't get paid and I can't afford not to.  You don't realise how vulnerable you are in an unsecure job until something like cancer hits you.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Sorry to sound a bit thick but do you mean E45 before each zap? Then aloe Vera after each zap?  I haven't been offered any creams only to speak to the nurse if I notice any problems.x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I am on zap 8 today but my left boob feels like it's grown. I am finding differing advice regarding creams, deodorants & showering. What should I use and not use?
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I have been having baths through radiotherapy had the 9th yesterday 6 to go. Using aloe Vera gel and e45 but may try bio oil after I've finished treatment. Also need to remember to get good sun block for summer as no sun allowed now on the rads site.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Unfortunately I am working so I have to go when I finish on an evening. I work in a school so may request different times next week as I am on half term. 3rd treatment tonight so we see how long I have to wait this time.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Yes nurse told me to carry on as normal and only stop or change stuff if I found it irritating me.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I had my second 'zap ' last night but again over an hours delay technical issues with the machines. The waiting around.....I have a life I need to live.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thank you JollyG cancer is something I didn't plan for so when the radiotherapy is over I'm going to look for a permanent job. Took my book to read last night but thankfully I only waited 10 mins extra so that's not a problem.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: 7th zap for me today. No side effects as yet although think my boob looks bigger. Nurse said carry on as normal with bathing and showering only change gels deodorants etc if I find my skin is getting irritated. Oncologist said sometimes the tiredness is psychological and can be from the journey there and back taking it's toll. We will see.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: 2 more zaps for me then all done. Been working fulltime two weeks after lumpectomy and been going for radiotherapy every evening after work. Slight soreness but hardly anything. Boob feels a bit warm but that's about it. No fatigue/ tiredness etc  Feeling great. The only time I felt ill was the day after my lumpectomy otherwise all good.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I genuinely don't think people ķnow what to say we just want some normality to talk about things other than cancer.  I would prefer if folks would just ask how are you I can reply then back to other conversations not about cancer.
Posts.Title: Just need a rant

Posts.Content: If you feel happier not telling your parents don't. Sometimes it's an extra burden not only for them but for you too.  Telling family is one of the hardest things. Do whatever feels right for you, yes listen to others.x
Posts.Title: Telling Family

Posts.Content: Sounds like me Ruby, My mum died of breast cancer and she lost her hair through chemo and she told me she'd felt embarrassed at times because people had commented on how nice her hair looked, it was a wig so she had to start to explain. Messaging lets you tell lots of people and I suppose I had lists A, B & C without even thinking about it. Luckily for me I don't need chemo just radiotherapy.  Even so I don't really remember the last few months it's all kind of been a haze and however bad it is we all come out the other side. Caz.xx
Posts.Title: Telling Family

Posts.Content: Also now I know some may not agree but I put a post on Facebook. I told close family and friends though.  I posted when I'd been diagosed and again when anything changed. I got lots of messages of support. It also created an awareness of breast cancer especially the fact that sometimes there are no symptoms and you don't always know there's a lump there until you have the mammogram.
Posts.Title: Telling Family

Posts.Content: I have taken 6 weeks of Letrozole and haven't noticed any side effects whatsoever. Everyone responds differently.Having my last radiotherapy a point tonight too and again no side effects.
Posts.Title: I am all mixed up - what's the difference between Letrozole and Tamoxifen...
